args:
Oh, you're not getting away.
Smuggling explosives from the north?
Detonating them in the city?
Your crimes are heavy indeed.
But how did you know to come here?\nAnd how did you figure out it was me?
I have been doubting you for some time,\nso I decided to have Cecile follow you.
In the form of investigating the smuggling.\nAnd thus, I caught you red-handed.\nSimple as that.
So when did you start to doubt me?
Around the time of the second bombing.
Cecile and I spent all our energies trying\nto find the bomb and came up with nothing\nuntil you arrived on the scene.
Which makes perfect sense if I consider\nthat it was placed there by you.
It also caught my attention that, since that\nincident, there had been a few threats,\nbut actual bombings had ceased.
That overlaps with the period of time you\nwere recovering from your burned legs.\nIt all adds up.

But your actions this morning were what
clinched it. When we were talking about
the smuggler, you flinched when we said
the word ＂individual.＂

It was a slight reaction, but one I could not
overlook. In addition, when you were
encouraging me, you said that tonight
would be ＂the main event.＂
You couldn't have known things would\ncome to a head tonight unless you were\nthe one behind it all.
Based on these suspicions, I surmised that\nthis bombing incident wasn't the work of a\ngroup but of an individual—you.

But as I lacked proof, I told you I would
take command of the city's guidance so
you would let your guard down, then had
Cecile follow you.
And I fell for it like a fool.
Does it feel good to outsmart a stupid kid?
With all my heart, Callan, I did not wish to\nbelieve that you were responsible for this.
Why? Why would you do such a thing,\nsowing terror and pain without making\neven a single demand?
I didn't make demands because I don't\nhave any. This was always about revenge.
Back then, you were so in love with your\ngrand ideals that you prioritized them over\nsaving my parents' lives.
Had you not chosen the foolish route, Leif,\nwe could have saved some of those lives.
Harle is right. It's my fault that those\npeople are dead.
In the end, all my talk of ideals was\nmerely wind. I did nothing to actually\nlive up to them.
So if that man had just come sooner,\nMom and Dad would still be alive?
They died because he had some stupid\nideal he wanted to hold onto?
Think of what it means to a child to learn\nthat your parents are dead because of\nsome knight's hollow desires.
I heard that the culprits were caught and\npunished shortly after the incident, yet you\nwalked away scot-free.
And on top of it, you have no remorse!\nYou continue to be a knight without a care\nas you tout your pathetic ＂ideals＂!
So that's why I wanted to shatter them\nonce and for all.
I lured you with the bomb threats, then\ncaused the incident so I could see your\nreaction up close.
I wanted you to despair. To suffer.\nI wanted to shatter your ideals into tiny\npieces. You want a motive? There it is.
You put the people of this city through such\nhorror for THAT?!
His actions are, of course, unacceptable.\nBut the reason for his being driven to this\npoint is mine.
I'm sorry I couldn't save your parents,\nCallan. I truly am.
But if you wanted to crush my spirit,\nI fear you have failed utterly—for I\nswore never to repeat that mistake.
That's why I worked to evacuate everyone\nto safety while trying to disarm the bombs.

To that end, I set up security, undertook
extensive rescue efforts, and turned to the
Halidom for aid before standing on the
front lines myself.
As I've aged, I've worked hard, grown\nstronger, and made new friends in order\nto realize my ideals.
And you think that means you've overcome\nthe mistakes of your past?
No. Sadly, my mistakes will ever remain.\nBut that is no reason to stop working\ntoward my dreams.

You're an idiot and your ideals are a
fantasy! You can't save everyone—hell,
you can't even save ME, because I'm going
to be condemned to death for my crimes!
Don't you get it? Your ideals have been\ndoomed to failure from the start!

I will not see you condemned to death so
thoughtlessly. That's another reason why
I worked to minimize the damage caused
by this incident.

I want to save the people of the city, and
that includes you—though you will still
have to answer for the crimes you did
manage to commit.

The crown and the people are the twin
jewels which make up a kingdom. And as
a knight in service to that kingdom, it is
my dream to protect them all.
So I will reach out to you again and again\nuntil the day I finally save you.
Enough! I won't hear one more word about\nhow wonderful and perfect you are, Leif!\nIt all makes me sick!
This will all have been a waste if I don't\ncrush your dream to bits here and now.
Hey! ...Stop! It's pointless to keep\nresisting! You've got nowhere to run!
I'm not running! Not when I have this.
Lie still. I'm going to get help.
See? You failed to save someone...again.
Fie, but this wound is deep...\nWhy, Callan? Why go this far?!
Ah, there is the face I wanted to see.\nDo you feel despair, Leif?\nDo you know...pain?
Your ideals...are naught but\ndust in the wind...
C'mon, don't let this chump break your\nspirit. You're better than that.
I am not broken, and I will never surrender\nmy ideals.
(You're going to get back up again...\nEven with such pain in your heart,\nyou're going to get up again!)
It hurts to fail yet again, and I feel terrific\nanger at my own sense of powerlessness.\nBut I must not let myself be broken by it.
I cannot yield my ideals if I hope to see\ntrue peace in Alberia, for I am a knight\nwho serves my regent and kingdom.
So I will carve Callan's death into my\nheart just as I did my past mistakes.

I will forever caution myself not to
become so caught up in my dreams that
I lose sight of reality and bring about
new sadness.
I will save all of Alberia's people.\nThis I swear!
